medical_history.chief_complaint: Burning sensation and edema affecting both hands after immersion in water.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began 1 year ago, arising within 1 to 3 minutes of water exposure, associated with swelling and thickening of the palms. Symptoms worsened in warmer weather and with more frequent swimming, with resolution occurring within 1 hour after removal from water.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Significant for mild asthma, requiring medication only as needed.
medical_history.family_history: No other family members were similarly affected.
